cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north–northeast, expected to cross the north-central Gulf Coast tonight then sweep northeastward across Alabama, Georgia and into the Carolinas before reaching the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near southeastern Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL; Lakes Pontchartrain, Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Tropical Storm Warning is in effect along the northern Gulf Coast from east of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL and adjacent bays/lakes
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA-FL Panhandle) and, after landfall, interior AL-GA and the western/central Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Sunday with gusts 25–35 mph as the remnant low tracks nearby
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the South Carolina coast from this system
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Sunday could total 2–4 inches, locally higher west of Charleston
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes possible inland across the Carolinas on Sunday
